attributes.action: Abolish the Data Protection Act now
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This ludicrous Act is not being used properly as I am deluged with junk mail but when I sought valid information from Thames Water about who had been paying my water rates, which were included in my rent and paid by my landlord, to present to a "Fair Rent Tribunal" as evidence because of a dispute, I was told they could not supply me with written confirmation (of what I already knew and had told them!)as it contravened this stupid Act!  It does not stop information sharing which is done anyway for the purposes of junk mail so who exactly does it protect apart from criminals!  Stop this insanity now!

rejection.details: Specific cases about the Data Protection Act should be taken to the Information Commissioner's Office. If you still wish to create a petition on this subject then please resubmit; but consider providing a broader case, that other petitioners can agree with, rather than a personal case.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
